Ban high-capacity magazines. Mass shooters often use magazines that hold 30 or more rounds. This means more shooting, less reloading and limited chances to stop a shooter. There’s no reason for these high-capacity magazines.

Assault Weapons Ban: We need to get these military-style assault weapons off the street! These aren’t for hunting or home protection, their only purpose is to kill as many people as possible, as quickly as possible. Poll: 60 percent of Americans support a ban.

Raise age for assault rifles. Today, an 18-year-old can’t buy a beer OR a handgun, but he can but an AR-15. Why a higher age limit for handguns and not the weapon of choice for mass shooters? Our bill raises the age to 21. Common sense. Poll: 71% of Americans support this.

Extreme-risk law. This bill would let loved ones or law enforcement go to court to get a lawful orders to remove firearms from people at risk of harming themselves or others. It protects due process and it’s common sense. Poll: 76% of Americans support this.

Universal background checks. Anyone can walk into a gun show or go online and buy a gun, with no checks at all. This isn’t a loophole, it’s a cataclysmic flaw in the system that lets any dangerous people buy as many guns as they want. Poll: 83% of Americans support this.

Schools are supposed to be safe havens, but instead we have active shooter drills and “run, hide, fight” exercises. How can society stomach this and not FORCE action? We have several bills that could immediately begin to stop the carnage.

67% of Americans say we need stronger gun safety laws. That’s up from 52 percent in 2013, and a big part of the reason is more school shootings. So what can you do? Call your representative and senator and DEMAND action on gun safety! Call 202-224-3121. https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/05/11/us/school-shootings-united-states.html …

Today’s @NYTimes analysis of school shootings goes in-depth on 111 shootings since 1970. All told, 202 were killed and 454 injured. Last year alone, 29 dead and 48 injured. It’s time to act!  https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/05/11/us/school-shootings-united-states.html …

The @WashingtonPost has a running database of school shootings, and it’s heartbreaking. Since the 1999 Columbine shooting, 234 schools (teaching 228,000 children) have suffered through a shooting. https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2018/local/school-shootings-database …

Our bill not only clarifies that conspiring with foreign nationals to influence U.S. elections is illegal, it also closes loopholes that allow foreign nationals to buy ads intended to directly influence elections.

There’s no question that Russia worked with Americans – unwitting or otherwise – to influence U.S. elections. Even though such activity is already illegal, those laws can and should be stronger. That’s why @SenBlumenthal and I have introduced a new bill.

Mr. Lee’s record shows that he is far outside the legal mainstream. Given the positions he has taken in dozens of articles — and given his failure to disclose writings to my commission and to this Committee — I cannot support Mr. Lee’s nomination to the Ninth Circuit.

Teachers have an outsized influence on their students. I have fond memories of one my own teachers, Mother Mardel, at Covent of the Sacred Heart, and on #TeacherAppreciationDay I want to thank all the teachers who are instilling our children with a lifelong love of learning.

The United States has some of the highest prescription drug prices in the world. Seniors shouldn’t have to choose between food or medicine and families shouldn’t have to skip doses to make ends meet. We must do more to address the rise of drug prices. https://youtu.be/b_FpphNluXM

Last week the Judiciary Committee passed the Debbie Smith Act. This law has already reduced the backlog of untested DNA rape kits, providing justice for rape survivors and getting dangerous predators off the streets. This is a successful program that should be reauthorized. pic.twitter.com/K3h8oYJQCb
#Ramadan Mubarak to all who are celebrating across the world and in California! Wishing everyone many blessings during this holy month.

I am extremely concerned about the death of an unaccompanied child in the care of HHS. There must be an investigation of the circumstances and actions that led to this tragedy to ensure it never happens again. pic.twitter.com/fNitQaQzcr
A free press is essential to democracy and to holding governments accountable for corruption and abuse. Journalists must be free to do their work and give the public a voice. #WorldPressFreedomDay

#NationalDrugCourtMonth, highlights the vital role treatment courts have played over the last 30 years. Drug courts save lives and reduce the burden on our judicial system by helping offenders suffering from addiction begin the road to recovery.

The federal government has a responsibility to safely store nuclear waste and it’s time we take action to solve this issue. That’s why @SenMurkowski, @SenAlexander and I have reintroduced legislation to create the Nuclear Waste Administration. https://twitter.com/lisamurkowski/status/1123984742825824256 …

The U.S. is in the midst of a gun violence epidemic that demands action. It’s far past time my Republican colleagues join me in passing commonsense gun reform to confront this crisis. pic.twitter.com/QBdjVolh1t

This #HolocaustRemembranceDay marks the 76th anniversary of the Warsaw Ghetto uprising. We must remember these victims and recommit ourselves to preventing these atrocities from happening again. Learn more about Jewish resistance during the uprising: https://encyclopedia.ushmm.org/content/en/article/warsaw-ghetto-uprising …

Mueller’s report confirms that the Russian government implemented a social media campaign to mislead millions of Americans and outlines efforts by the president to mislead the American people and interfere with the investigation. My full statement here: https://youtu.be/KI9SeZxPK0o

The Mueller report details 10 episodes of President Trump efforts to interfere in the investigation. The president repeatedly told Don McGahn, “Mueller has to go.” He then ordered McGahn to release a false statement saying the president did not order Mueller fired. pic.twitter.com/2g0hY5m4Cl
